Directions: Use the information below to answer each question that follows.
Content: As some students are planting flowers, they notice several earthworms in the soil. One student wonders if earthworms are beneficial to the growth of plants. The student decides to test this by performing an investigation. The student plants identical flowering plants in two containers with potting soil. The treatment for the plants is the same, except that six earthworms are added to one container. Figure 1 shows the plants after 65 days of growth.

The plant in the pot with earthworms appears to be healthier. The student describes it as having larger leaves, a thicker stem, a more upright stem, more root hairs, and longer roots than the plant in the container without the earthworms.
